definition[0]: to give someone a piece of information that someone else has given to you
example[0]: She said she’d pass the message on to the other students.
definition[1]: to give something, especially a disease, to your children through your genes
definition[2]: to give a slight illness to someone else
example[1]: One catches the virus and they pass it on to the rest.
definition[3]: to make someone else pay the cost of something
example[2]: Any increase in our costs will have to be passed on to the consumer.
definition[4]: to die – use this when you want to avoid saying the word ‘die’
definition[5]: if a company passes on increased costs of providing products or services to its customers, it increases the prices of its products or services to pay for these costs. If the company passes on lower costs, it makes the prices of its products or services lower
example[3]: Cable companies should pass on cost reductions to customers rather than earn fatter profit margins.
